posts.post_content:
Use with decks that prefer huge ammount of weak tokens rather than huge creatures, like with the Convoke ability. Additionally, it can be used to save your creatures from destroy target spells.  
  
If you're also playing with Red, you can use those cheap X/1 creatures that gets sacrificed at end of turn like [Elemental Appeal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental Appeal) and [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning)

Posted By: AXER (8/28/2010 9:58:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
If you underestimate the power a mercy killing holds i'll tribal you any day.  
  
First of all it is a creature removal, ok so not a Great creature removal but still if there's a god sire on your opponents side let them have the elves.  
  
Secondly it's a instant speed elf generator. let's pretend there about to trash your [jagged-scar archers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=jagged-scar archers) then why not throw a mercy killing at it and have a small elves army ready for your coat of arms to pump up.  
  
I am defending this card because it has saved me games mostly when combo'd with a [heedless one](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=heedless one) or [wirewood pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wirewood pride) .
posts.html:
If you underestimate the power a mercy killing holds i'll tribal you any day.

First of all it is a creature removal, ok so not a Great creature removal but still if there's a god sire on your opponents side let them have the elves.

Secondly it's a instant speed elf generator. let's pretend there about to trash your jagged-scar archers then why not throw a mercy killing at it and have a small elves army ready for your coat of arms to pump up.

I am defending this card because it has saved me games mostly when combo'd with a heedless one or wirewood pride .

posts.post_content:
Good thing it's an instant, so you can use this with undercosted strong creatures that have an upkeep drawback - which would in fact make it a mercy killing, since they would have died anyways; possibly a slow and painful death.  
[Sheltering Ancient](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheltering Ancient) makes a good shelter for five Elf Warriors.  
[Phyrexian Soulgorger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Soulgorger)'s soul can get gorged for eight Elf Warriors."  
  
A [Sigil Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Captain) can promote you all of these.  
You can also grant them an [Elvish Promenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Promenade) to [Oran-Rief, the Vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oran-Rief, the Vastwood).  
If you let them visit [Voice of the Woods](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of the Woods), they can call his best friend together.  
[Priest of Titania](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Titania) will gladly join them as well. Once she's there, i'm pretty sure a lot of others will follow:  
Where she is, there is mana. And where is mana, there is action!  
  
If you have something like a [Serendib Sorcerer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serendib Sorcerer), mercy killing your opponent's [Darks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darks)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Phyrexian Soulgorger's soul can get gorged for eight Elf Warriors."

posts.post_content: Really like this card maybe for its duel-functions. you can use it on either side of the board - your own creature in response to your creature being targeted for death and dodge it to have a bunch of 1/1's instead of nothing. or you can remove any creature effectively, even one's that could otherwise regenerate or indestructible card which is hard to find anywhere. and hey, with [Muraganda Petroglyphs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Muraganda Petroglyphs) out, a 5/5 elephant from [Call of the Heard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call of the Heard) "Mercifully Killed" yields you.... 5 3/3's. Fun.
posts.html:
